instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
Hi I have a board missing PM_SLP_S4_L
Cpu prerequisites:
ppvrtc_reset_L=3.3v
Pch_srtcrst_L=3.32v
Pch_intvrmen_L=3.24v
Pch_dswvrmen_L=.489mv
Sysclk_clk32k_rtcx1=.489mv
PP3v3_s5=3.3v
Pp3v3_sus=2.7v
Pm_batlow_L=3.3v
Pm_rsmrst_L= 3.4mv
Pm_pwrbtn_L=3.45v

I also have power u6100 on pins 8,5 but not on pin 1 (SPI_MLB_CS_L)=.489v

Shouldn’t the bios output 3.3 on pin 1 ? Is it a bios or Should I try that trick of hearing cpu like on the last board?

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
"Pch_dswvrmen_L=v"
???

"Pp3v3_sus=2.7v"
Post PM_SLP_SUS_L level and Q7802/20 voltages.

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
PCH_DSWVRMEN_L= .489mv
I’m not sure but the brd file say pin 1 of u6100 is 
PM_SLP_SUS_L =0v

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
"PCH_DSWVRMEN_L= .489mv"
Do you mean PCH_DSWVRMEN instead?
Check R1915.

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
I have 3.16v at pin 2 of R1915
It measures 193k not the 390k it supposed to

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
Broken trace???
Pin 2/R1915 is PCH_DSWVRMEN.
Where did you check it before, as that is the only point accessible???

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
I’m sorry I was Hurricane preparing.  no it’s was a bad solder joint. It’s good now r1915 pin2=3.2v  checked it multiple times. Touched up the joint. Now on to why my Pp3v3_sus is low
I’m going to check the Level of Q7802/20 voltages.
As you suggested

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
At Q7802
Pins:
1-GND
2-P3V3_S4_EN= 479mv
3-P3V3SUS_EN_L= 3.3v
4-GND
5-PM_SUS_EN=0
6-PP3V3S4_EN_L=0

Q7820
Pins:
1- PP3V3_SUS=3.3v
2-P3V3SUS_SS=3.3v
3-PP3V3_S5=3.3v
4-PP3v3_S5=3.3v

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: Ok I grounded SMC_ONOFF_L at c5710 and the PM_PWRBTN_L at R2502 Ok yes it did drop down to 400mv and went back up to 1.6v

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
"yes it did drop down to 400mv and went back up to 1.6v"
It should have 3.3V in normal state; check it with KB disconnected.

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: The logic board is bare on my desk nothing connected When I tested it

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: Do you have steady 3V at SMC_ONOFF_L?

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: Yes SMC_ONOFF_L= 3.44v and steady

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
"it did drop down to 400mv and went back up to 1.6v"
Then what this mean?

Check if all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals pulse at same time when PM_PWRBTN_L drops.

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
Ok my mistake. When you ask me to short SMC_ONOFF_L to ground and check to see if I had a drop in voltage at PM_PWRBTN_L yes it does drop down to 400mv and then back up to 1.6v and when I said  "it did drop down to 400mv and went back up to 1.6v" I was referring to PM_PWRBTN_L
I will check to see if all the sleep signals “PM_SLP_Sx_L” pulse at the same time as
“ PM_PWRBTN_L” thank you for your help

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
PM_PWRBTN_L also MUST go back to 3V when you realease power button.
In fact, it should be steady 3V and only drops when SMC_ONOFF_L is triggered.

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: Ok cool I’ll check that as well and report back

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
Ok on R1985 on pin 1 =3.3v on pin 2=1.6v
I removed R1985 and measured it is 1k what schematic say is correct. When I power the board with out resistor I get pin 1= 3.3v and pin 2 = 1.6v so the 1.6 is either coming from smc or pch. I get 1.6v from Both pins of r2502 With R1985, R2585 removed. But on the schematic it say “in” to smc :( so is this signal being sent by pch low ? Or should I remove R2502?

I will post the “PM_SLP_Sx_L“ signals as soon as I figure out why PM_PWRBTN_L is low as of now the sleep signals are 0v but I’m guessing that has a lot todo with the resistors I have removed.

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: I will post the “PM_SLP_Sx_L“ signals as soon as I figure out why PM_PWRBTN_L is low as of now the sleep signals are 0v but I’m guessing that has a lot todo with the resistors I have removed.

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
Either PCH, or SMC pull down PM_PWRBTN_L.
You can try heating PCH with quality flux, to discard an issue created by accumulated crap underneath.
Also do the same with SMC...

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
Ok will do 180 degrees with AMTECH flux on both and no it didn’t anything. I reinstalled R1985 testEd with R2502 Removed and  I have 3.42v coming from smc on on pin 1 of the location of R2502 with resistor removes . Is this correct? 3.42v out from pin 49 of smc? 

I tested at the location of R1985 without resistor and at first it was 3.3v on pin 1, pin 2 had zero. I held it there for 20 seconds then the 1.6v came up again. What else could be leaking voltage on this line as I have found nothing else connected ?

threads.title: 820-2915 missing PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
R1985 pulls-up PM_PWRBTN_L.
SMC, or PCH can only sink current.
One of them is bad, or corrosion between balls pulls-down the signal.
